original: CHRISTIANSEN, Thomas, Bergsingenjör, Sandviken, f Karlstad 30/10 03 av sjökapt Chr C o Adéle Christiansen, gm Margit Thorsson (d). Ex KTH (metallurgi) 28. Anst v IVA 28—29, Motala Verkst (ch f värme- o ångtekn avd:a) 29—37, Sandvikens Jernverks AB (tekn ekonomi) sed. 37, ch f Stat Bränslekommiss :s planläggn.avd 41—43. RVO.
translated: CHRISTIANSEN, Thomas, Mining Engineer, Sandviken, son of sea captain Chr C and Adéle Christiansen, born in Karlstad on 30/10/03, married to Margit Thorsson (deceased). Former student of the Royal Institute of Technology (metallurgy) in 1928. Employed at the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences (IVA) from 1928 to 1929, Motala Verkst (chief of the heat and steam technology department) from 1929 to 1937, Sandvikens Jernverks AB (technical economy) since 1937, and chief of the Fuel Commission's planning department from 1941 to 1943. Received the Royal Order of Vasa.

memberOf.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences (IVA)

career.occupational_title: Chief of the Heat and Steam Technology Department
Chief of the Fuel Commission's Planning Department
